name: Essential Milan Free Tour (Available in English, Italian)
shortDescription:
Like any newcomer to town, the same question arises: where will my visit begin?

We will help you discover Milan in a completely different way and following two main lines: on the one hand, we will take a historical approach to the origins of the city , visiting the main monuments:

  • Milan Cathedral.
  • Sforzesco Castle.
  • Sempione Park.
  • Navigli.
  • Columns of San Lorenzo.
  • Porta Ticinese
  • and the most hidden streets of the city which seems huge, but is easily passable with its flat streets crossed by the characteristic Tram line.


We will focus on the stage of the Castello Sforzesco: defensive fortress, residence, military barracks.
Royal Palace. Here you can breathe an atmosphere of ancient ceremonials of court life in the rooms of the Palace and among the refined receptions of the past.
Madonnina of the Milan Cathedral. Symbol of the city, phrases such as "in the shadow of the Madonnina" indicate the city of Milan .
Milan Cathedral. We will take a walk around to admire the side decorations of the gigantic late Gothic style Opera Church.
Columns of San Lorenzo: just beyond the Porta Ticinese here are the Roman columns in front of the Basilica of San Lorenzo

Our tour continues going up towards the Duomo, passing through via dei Mercanti we arrive at Piazza Cordusio. Walk in the famous crossroads of history, culture and elegance with Italian fashion shops and renowned places as the setting for this short intense tour of Milan where it will be nice to meet new people and see the city that will make you fall in love with the amazement of the central streets and those more hidden full of attractions.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Kick off Milan: Express English Sightseeing Tour with official guide (Available in English)
description:
Enjoy the exclusive Milan Express tour presented by an official licensed local tour guide.

Walk with us through the most essential Milan: you will discover the soul of the city through its must see and landmarks.

A short but intense tour: insiders info, lots of audiovisual materials, maps, and more.

Mixed topics: During this simple but rich tour we will touch many topics..History, local culture and traditions, gastronomy, sport, geography, religion, LGBT+ and much more!

This express tour is strongly recommended if you have a short time in Milan!

A digital guidebook written by your guide with food recommendations, things to do, nightlife, flea-markets, gelato suggestions and much more will be provided to enjoy the rest of your stay.



Are you ready to fall in love!? 


More complete private paid tours are available writing to: frogwalkingtour@gmail.com


🚩IMPORTANT INFORMATION:
• Reservation is compulsory
• Large groups are not accepted. The free tours will consist of singles, partners and groups of less than 4 people who know each other. We reserve the right to deny participation to any group for any reason. Our goal is to create a friendly environment and socialize with each other.
• In case of strikes, bad weather and demonstrations, the tour may be cancelled, and all tours start with a minimum number of pax.
• By signing up for a tour you agree to all these rules.


Tips to plan your stay: https://bit.ly/extratipsmilan
Info About the tour: https://bit.ly/whatineedtoknow

More Info: www.frogwalkingtour.com

🚩ALL TOURS IN ENGLISH

 

 

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free Walking Tour through Renaissance Milan: Beauty and Philosophy (Available in English)
shortDescription:
Walk through the most beautiful places in Milan to show you the Gothic-Renaissance art and architecture styles and their profound philosophical wisdom.

You will understand the symbols in architecture, urbanism, and art that reflect beautiful principles. You will see places not only as mere spaces but as the result of deep alchemical knowledge. The city will gain a special meaning, becoming alive and exciting!
I will also show you hidden treasures in the center of Milan, specially chosen for this walk.

We will talk about the Neoplatonic philosophy that inspired the greatest masters of the Renaissance who lived in Milan, such as Leonardo da Vinci and Donato Bramante.

We will see how architectural beauty and urban planning were intended to remind the man of the beauty that he has within himself and that can be achieved through the development of values, virtues, and intelligence.

Itinerary*:

  • Sforzesco Castle
  • Via Dante
  • Duomo
  • Piazza della Scala

* the itinerary may vary depending on the days, because some places open on different days / times of the week, and there may be exhibitions or other attractions that are worth visiting.


***ATTENTION: ONLY book if you have a real interest in culture, philosophy, art and/or architecture, AND if you are SURE you will participate! (There are just a few seats on this tour to ensure a great experience, so, please, book only if you are committed to this premise)***

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Walking with Biscione (Available in English)
description:
Walking with Biscione is a historical walking tour including must-see attractions of Milano. Milano is known as the heart of fashion. Indeed there are both modern and ancient sites to visit. We start with one of the largest citadels in Europe, Sforzesco castle. While we are walking, we talk about Milan history. We have chance to visit following sites: 1. Castello Sforzesco 2. Via Dante 3. Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II 4. Cattedrale di Duomo 5. Statue of Vittorio Emanuele II. And many other old and modern buildings..


IMPORTANT:
Please consider following notices: 
If you can’t find spot, let me know. 

This tour is in English.

The minimum payment is 10€ per person. 

I don’t accept group (more than 4 persons). 

Minimum number of participants are 2 PAX. So, wait for a confirmation from my side. I will send you a message that the tour will be held or not. 

This tour is a small group tour (max 10 persons), and if you’re a group of people (more than 4) send me a message before booking.

Don’t book the tour for one, then show up with others, please let me know you’ve done booking for 2/more instead of one.

This is a historical tour, I’m not going to talk that much about Modern Milano but we will discover this city from different point of views. Only if you’re interested in history, register for this tour. 

All tours are available in Farsi for Persian speaking travelers.

If you don’t want to show up, cancel your tour and let others book the tour. There are a few spots available for each tour.

Milan is environmentally friendly city, so have refillable water bottle with yourselves we have water stop.

Please do NOT book my tour, if you are not interested in continuous walking for about 2 hours.

Thank you and Milano ti aspetta :)

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Wonders of Milan - Free Walking Tour (Available in English, Spanish)
description:
With this free walking tour, you will explore Milan as a local. Regardless of your travel budget, our guides will do everything possible to make sure you discover all the secrets and beauty of this city. From the Duomo to the Castello Sforzesco, from the Statale University to the Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II ... and many more! You will discover the most symbolic places in the history of the capital of Lombardy, and you will experience the spirit of Milan through different eras.
What are we going to visit? 

  • San Nazaro in Brolo church 
  • Statale University 
  • Duomo 
  • Castello Sforzesco 
  • Vittorio Emanuele II Gallery 
  • Theater y Piazza Della Scala 
  • Merchants Square 
  • Business Square 


Note: The tour plan can change, according to our guide preferences.

In the case of groups larger than 6 persons, please contact us for a private tour. Groups with more than 6 persons will be refused.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Spirit of Travel - Free Tour Milan (Available in English)
description:
Join this guruwalk if you want to discover the real beauty of the city of Milan!
 During this free tour, we will cover the most important sites in Milan, as well as the best places where the locals go to eat and have fun.
The itinerary consists of:

  • Visiting the Duomo Cathedral
  • The Vittoria Emanuele Gallery admiring his architectural work. Shops and the legend Bull for a wish.
  • Sforza Castel for its huge garden in the Sempione park and a view of the site of "ARCH OF PEACE"
  • The church "Santa Maria Della Grazia"
  • The famous painting and masterpiece of Leonardo Da Vinci
  • The Last Supper
  • Pinacoteca Di Brera: famous for the collection of Italian art in the Porto Nuovo area for the skyscraper.
  • The Vertical Bush Apartments (Milan posh area) Corso Como 10 Shop for unique and stylish souvenirs and gadgets and maybe a drink or dinner here.


Go shopping / visit Montenapoleone street and its famous designer boutiques.
Navigli Canals for its water and live life, happy hour, music, pubs and restaurants to attend at sunset.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end
